page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content:
Compstall Mill. The Andrew Family:
The first George Andrew was born in 1779. He moved to Compstall and lived in a building called Werneth Hall. In 1820 the first building for printing was erected.In June 28th 1824 the first cloth was woven from the yarn that had been spun in the mill.Between 1820_24 houses were erected for the workers. When George Andrew died his son took over his job,he was called George Andrew 2nd.He installed schools for children ,a public reading room for his workers and a brass band pavilion. The cotton mill was officially closed on August 12th 1966 and the mill was taken over by Compstall Mill Estates who let out the weaving sheds to twenty or so small light industries.
